Sentencas: Segmented-in-series solid oxide fuel cell (SIS-SOFC) is prepared by laminating cell components on all sides of partially stabilized zirconia supports using decalcomania method.
Titulo: Effect of cell-to-cell distance in segmented-in-series solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Since such support is conductive, it generates shunting current and hence voltage loss occurs.
Titulo: Effect of cell-to-cell distance in segmented-in-series solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Such loss compromises the benefit achieved by segmenting solid oxide fuel cell in series.
Titulo: Effect of cell-to-cell distance in segmented-in-series solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Therefore there would be greater merits to study the effect of cell-to-cell distance on the voltage loss.
Titulo: Effect of cell-to-cell distance in segmented-in-series solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Output characteristics according to the cell distance is reported in this study.
Titulo: Effect of cell-to-cell distance in segmented-in-series solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Open circuit voltage and maximum output density show higher value in the order of cell distance of 2, 3 and 1 mm.
Titulo: Effect of cell-to-cell distance in segmented-in-series solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: While the shunting current decreases with increasing cell distance, the ohmic resistance, however, increases with increasing cell distance as the interconnector length increases.
Titulo: Effect of cell-to-cell distance in segmented-in-series solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The impedance analysis shows that the polarization resistance decreases substantially as the cell distance decreases.
Titulo: Effect of cell-to-cell distance in segmented-in-series solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This study demonstrates that care should be taken for the SIS-SOFC as the cell-to-cell distance influences the output characteristics.
